description.narrative: By end 2021 in targeted zones the DNTA, the divisions of the Ministry of Public Health and NGOs have the capacity to implement nutrition emergency preparedness and response for women, adolescents and children under five years, which contributes to Infant And Young Child Feeding, Nutrition And Emergencies, Nutrition â€“ General, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 2. By the end of 2021, adolescents, pregnant and breastfeeding women, mothers and children aged 0-5 years make greater use of quality nutritional services and adopt adequate nutrition and feeding practices in 15 provinces.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end 2021 in targeted zones the DNTA, the divisions of the Ministry of Public Health and NGOs have the capacity to implement nutrition emergency preparedness and response for women, adolescents and children under five years

description.narrative: The DNTA, the branches of the MSP and NGOs are better able to prepare an emergency nutritional response, thanks to the drafting of normative documents including the guide on setting up sentinel sites, the prior identification of areas at high risk of crisis, the development of a contingency plan, and the establishment of an early detection system for cases of malnutrition based on screening during lean periods. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:09/02/2020
